blog.title: Towers That Were Strong
blog.description: Hey supporting complex fictional characters is serious business!

summary: Pictured above are two equals, with the same outlook on the world and the same belief system. Both young, both having survived...
body:
‘Dany gave Jon everything and he gave her nothing!’ - WRONG.

Pictured above are two equals, with the same outlook on the world and the same belief system. Both young, both having survived traumatic events and both isolated from the groups around them.

But they’re not equal when it comes to wealth. He’s been crowned King of an impoverished kingdom facing down certain doom. She’s pretty much the ASOIAF military equivalent of a self-made billionaire tycoon. So when Jon asks for her aid against a war which is as much her war as it’s his, even if there’s no conceivable way she’s going to believe it, what can he give her in return? What’s he got, in terms of material wealth, which she doesn’t already have in abundance?

The answer to that is nothing. He CAN’T give her anything in return in the same terms as men or dragons BECAUSE HE DOESN’T HAVE THEM. It’s the equivalent of one partner being well off and being able to afford the nice things in life while the other can’t. And all the friends of the well-off partner judging the other for not being able to live up to the same standards of living.

But then again it’s true, Dany lost Viserion and most of the Dothraki (or half, or whatever proportion was in the script at that point of time). And she did lose them in the North. But ah, saying that she lost her men and her dragons to JON’S war is insane. Just because those two jackasses couldn’t bother spending more than an episode to culminate a story which literally began the series doesn’t mean it’s not the apocalyptic threat it’s always meant to be. It’s not Jon’s war or the North’s war. It war for all who live - the North just happened to be first in line. And as such, Dany’s forces have the most dead simply because they’re the most numerous. It was always going to be the case.

So getting back to the transactional part of their alliance - what can Jon trade in return for her material goods? What does he have which can be valuable enough? There’s only thing - his metaphorical crown. Dany gets the North back as one of her kingdoms and whatever is left of the Northern army during her own campaign. Which, by the way, is EMPHATICALLY Dany’s war. She gets everything material Jon COULD have afforded.

Now let’s get to the immaterial exchange. Dany gives him her heart, her belief and a reason for Jon to truly live again. Jon gives her HIS heart and his unshakeable loyalty. When doesn’t he stand up for her, in the open and behind closed doors? He defends her to his lords, to Sansa, to Dany’s own advisors and to Arya. If Jon makes Dany believe in the goodness of love again, it’s Dany who brings back Jon’s faith in doing the right thing. The faith which was obliterated after his murder. He believes in her vision and her capability whole-heartedly.

Until it all changes. And FUCK this change.

The saddest part of this season is having the Jon and Dany fans turn against each other due to knee-jerk emotional reactions and major cognitive dissonance. Dany’s genocide didn’t happen at all - but Jon totally took everything he could from her, used her love for his own ends and then killed her. It’s definitely not a problem that Dany’s first thought on hearing about his heritage was how it affects HER power and not how lost Jon would be. But it’s definitely Jon’s betrayal to Dany for letting HIS truth be known to HIS family.

Either nothing in Episodes 4 to 6 happened - thus Dany didn’t suddenly become a paranoid power hungry female villain stereotype and Jon did NOT kill her.

- She realised that being insecure of his parentage to the extent of asking JON to hide the truth for fear of her throne was beneath her. Jon realised that all he needed to do was tell her that he his entire life was a lie and he needs time to be able to think clearly again, but he still feels exactly the same about her. She doesn’t suddenly turn blind up in the air and 'kind of forget about the Iron Fleet’. She spots the ships and does what she’s the best at and Missandei doesn’t get captured and killed. Jon spectacularly loses it on the beach when Varys suggests supplanting her and almost breaks his neck. They BOTH realise that the last Targaryens need to stick together.

Or - everything in those episodes DID happen. She DID annihilate the poorest sections of KL for no reason, showed no remorse, relished in the destruction and flat out told Jon that his remaining family wouldn’t live. Jon did have to face the fact that her bloodlust affected everyone around him to the extent that surrendering soldiers were treated as charging ones and that his own men would become the kind of vicious beasts who would destroy and rape and pillage during a conquest. He did have to walk through the streets with ash floating down like snow and realise that she killed people whose only fault was to try and make a home in KL. She did turn Mad Queen, and only then did Jon kill her. You can’t pick and choose. Either reject fully, or accept fully.

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

title: Northern Ravens - Chapter 4
body:
Sansa is Queen in the North while Jon is banished to serve the Night’s Watch for the rest of his life. And yet, Sansa can’t just accept that Jon can never come home again, that he will never be able to answer the feelings she has for him, that she will have to marry someone else to let him father the future heirs of the North. And so she sends ravens. Ravens to Jon to tell him how much she misses him. And ravens to Bran to ask him when it is safe to end Jon’s punishment and bring him back to Winterfell.

Chapter 1 // Chapter 2 // Chapter 3

Even though her lips were red and swollen from kissing and even though she was out of breath because she couldn’t bring herself to separate her mouth from his long enough to breath, Sansa still longed to be much closer to Jon that she currently was. He had his arms firmly wrapped around her and yet she hated the thick layers of clothing they were wearing to protect themselves against the piercing cold. For too long she had had to miss his touch and the heat of his body keeping her warm. Now she was finally here, staying here in the cold with all those eyes watching them and all those clothes on seemed like a waste of what little time they had together.

But she was a Queen now and all those people staring at them were her people. And no matter how much she wanted to lock herself up with him in his bedroom to not come out again until they had to leave again, she knew she couldn’t do so.

He was her lover, the man she wanted to marry, the future father of her children and the King she wanted to rule besides her. But he was also the man who had gathered the biggest army ever seen, who had made it possible to defeat the Night King and who had saved the North of what could have been a bloodbath by killing the Dragon Queen before she could unleash her dragon on the very place she had helped to protect.

“I wish we could take you home with us…” Sansa exhaled. Her warm breath was visible in the cold winter air. “But Bran told me it was too early, too soon.” She let her head rest on his broad shoulder. She doubted if he was still fighting or practicing with his sword and yet she couldn’t imagine anyone else she’d feel this safe and at home with. “I’m glad he gave me an excuse to come here and visit you, though…”

Jon’s hand went through her hair and he twirled a loose strand around the tip of his finger. “I’m not sure if I’m glad he made you do that.” He whispered and his lips were almost touching her ear. “Because now I’ve got to let you go again. And I don’t know if I can do that.”

Sansa closed her eyes. She knew that Jon was right. In a few weeks she would have to get on her horse again and that horse would carry her back to Winterfell. And neither of them knew when they would see each other again. But she didn’t want to ruin this moment of happiness, of finally being with him again and being able to talk to him again without having to wait days for an answer. “You shouldn’t talk about that yet. We have a few more weeks before I have to leave again, maybe by then you will be tired of me and get headaches because I’m talking too much.”

Jon smiled and his lips kissed her forehead. “I’ll never grow tired of you.” He pressed the palms of his hands to her glowing cheeks before he kissed her slightly parted lips again. “And you can talk as much as you like. I missed hearing your ramblings and I missed your voice of reason.”

Sansa’s lips curled up, but the magical moment was disturbed when one of her guards cleared his throat.

“My apologies, your majesties.” His voice trembled slightly. “It’s getting dark soon. We need to unsaddle the horses and get them comfortable for the night.”

Sansa looked at Jon, but Jon kept silent. She was the Queen now, she was the ruler of the North now and just like everyone else Jon now waited for her commands. “Jon…” She remembered that she had promised to ask him how her men should address him. “Could you send a few men to help the Northerners to settle?”

“Of course, my Queen.” Jon nodded and stepped back from her to talk to a few of his friends, who kept a polite distance ever since Sansa had rushed through the gate. He maybe was no longer a King and he maybe didn’t even want to be one anymore, but he still moved and behaved like one. Not like the one who would just order people around to do whatever he wanted them to do. He still was the kind of King people wanted to fight for and fight with. He still was the kind of King people believed in and trusted with their lives.

A few seconds later his men walked towards the gathered Northern caravan and lead them away to the stables so the horses could finally get some well deserved rest.

“You can banish a King from his Kingdom, but he’ll always be a King…” Sansa only realised that she had said the words out loud when Jon let his forehead rest on hers.

“I’m not a King anymore, Sansa.” Jon spoke softly. “And I don’t need to be one. The North has a Queen, a wonderful Queen.” He smiled. “She’s intelligent and just. She’s soft and strong. She’s beautiful and brave.” He paused for a moment and his eyes stared straight into hers. “And she most of all doesn’t need a King.”

“I do need a King.” Sansa closed her eyes. She was intelligent and just and soft and strong and beautiful and brave. But she was also just a girl who longed to be loved and cared for. “I do need you.”

“But not as your King.” Jon’s nose brushed hers. “Even when Bran says it’s okay for me to come home…” He swallowed. “I still don’t wanna be King again.” His lips touched hers carefully. “I want to be your husband. I want to be the father of your children. I want to help you raise the future Kings and Queens in the North.” He shook his head. “But I really don’t want to be King anymore.”

“I was already designing a beautiful crown for you.” Sansa placed her hands on his shoulders. “One to match my tiara.”

“You shouldn’t be making me a crown. You should make one for you. A real crown for a true Queen, for the rightful ruler of the most beautiful Kingdom of Westeros.”

The smile on Sansa’s face brightened and then she kissed him once more. “If only all Kings, Princes and Lords I encountered had been like you. The world would have been a much better place.”

But she didn’t want to ruin this moment of happiness, of finally being with him again and being able to talk to him again without having to wait days for an answer. “You shouldn’t talk about that yet. We have a few more weeks before I have to leave again, maybe by then you will be tired of me and get headaches because I’m talking too much.”

Jon smiled and his lips kissed her forehead. “I’ll never grow tired of you.” He pressed the palms of his hands to her glowing cheeks before he kissed her slightly parted lips again. “And you can talk as much as you like. I missed hearing your ramblings and I missed your voice of reason.”

Sansa’s lips curled up, but the magical moment was disturbed when one of her guards cleared his throat.

“My apologies, your majesties.” His voice trembled slightly. “It’s getting dark soon. We need to unsaddle the horses and get them comfortable for the night.”

Sansa looked at Jon, but Jon kept silent. She was the Queen now, she was the ruler of the North now and just like everyone else Jon now waited for her commands. “Jon…” She remembered that she had promised to ask him how her men should address him. “Could you send a few men to help the Northerners to settle?”

“Of course, my Queen.” Jon nodded and stepped back from her to talk to a few of his friends, who kept a polite distance ever since Sansa had rushed through the gate. He maybe was no longer a King and he maybe didn’t even want to be one anymore, but he still moved and behaved like one. Not like the one who would just order people around to do whatever he wanted them to do. He still was the kind of King people wanted to fight for and fight with. He still was the kind of King people believed in and trusted with their lives.

A few seconds later his men walked towards the gathered Northern caravan and lead them away to the stables so the horses could finally get some well deserved rest.

“You can banish a King from his Kingdom, but he’ll always be a King…” Sansa only realised that she had said the words out loud when Jon let his forehead rest on hers.

“I’m not a King anymore, Sansa.” Jon spoke softly. “And I don’t need to be one. The North has a Queen, a wonderful Queen.” He smiled. “She’s intelligent and just. She’s soft and strong. She’s beautiful and brave.” He paused for a moment and his eyes stared straight into hers. “And she most of all doesn’t need a King.”

“I do need a King.” Sansa closed her eyes. She was intelligent and just and soft and strong and beautiful and brave. But she was also just a girl who longed to be loved and cared for. “I do need you.”

“But not as your King.” Jon’s nose brushed hers. “Even when Bran says it’s okay for me to come home…” He swallowed. “I still don’t wanna be King again.” His lips touched hers carefully. “I want to be your husband. I want to be the father of your children. I want to help you raise the future Kings and Queens in the North.” He shook his head. “But I really don’t want to be King anymore.”

“I was already designing a beautiful crown for you.” Sansa placed her hands on his shoulders. “One to match my tiara.”

“You shouldn’t be making me a crown. You should make one for you. A real crown for a true Queen, for the rightful ruler of the most beautiful Kingdom of Westeros.”

The smile on Sansa’s face brightened and then she kissed him once more. “If only all Kings, Princes and Lords I encountered had been like you. The world would have been a much better place.”

summary: help I’ve been in my robb n jon feels for hours. “I could name him (my son) Robb” / “jon would never harm a son of mine” sknsks...
question: help I’ve been in my robb n jon feels for hours. “I could name him (my son) Robb” / “jon would never harm a son of mine” sknsks I WANNA SCRAAMMMMM
answer:
UGHHHHH STARKLINGS ❤️❤️ Robb and Jon hurt me they really do. (Reading about childhood memories Jon has of the two of them - tipping snow piles off the Winterfell barracks onto people walking below, the time the two of them scheme to cover Jon in flour and scare their other siblings in the crypt)

And one of my favourite ASOIAF scenes is Robb firmly reminding his mother that Jon is Ned’s son too, and point blank putting him down in his will as the next heir to Winterfell. He trusts him entirely. Theon has betrayed him but he KNOWS Jon never ever would. God I love them.

blog.name: waking-dreams-of-harmony
blog.title: Headcanon is the new reality...
blog.description:
Hi there! My name is Ellie! Welcome to my tumblr!  Just thought I'd add a few things to know about me and my blog! If my url gives you any clues, at the heart of this tumblr, I'm a proud Harmony shipper through and through. And while I do still reblog HHR and Dan and Emma content (and I always will) you will find that the majority of my focus has shifted to Jonerys (Jon x Daenerys from Game of Thrones). And while you might have to do a little deep blogging to find my reblogs on these, I also ship--both passionately and casually--Cesare x Lucrezia, Mulder x Scully, Lizzington for a while until tptb started to mess with it, Baker x Lawson (Bawson), all the Sense8 ships though Kalagang is my #1, Clint x Natasha (Clintasha), Jane x Thor (Fosterson), Darcy x Loki (Tasertricks), Darcy x Steve (Shieldshock), Kili x Tauriel (Kiliel), Superman x Wonder Woman (Superwonder), and more than I have space for or the memory to list. 
I do my best to tag every post so that if something is your notp, it's nsfw, or it's triggering, you can blacklist it. That said, if you follow me and there is something that you need tagged in order to make it a happy place for you to explore, come into my inbox and let me know :) You will also see a lot of politically charged reblogs in support of women, the queer/gender-queer and trans community, BLM, Muslims, POC, Jewish people, the mentally ill, and austistic people. I'm strongly pro choice, pro inter-sectional feminism, and refuse to call the angry cheeto currently living in the white house president. If anything like that offends you, this might not be the right blog for you.
Last little few things to throw out there: I'm 35, I plan to adopt at least 4 cats (or more) at some point and be that cat lady everyone's always whispering about, and I tend to greet and converse with everyone I meet like an overeager puppy. 
Whew! Sorry for the long intro folks! Please enjoy your time here, and remember, you're always welcome to come in and say hi!

summary: Til Death Do Us Part... - Wedding Day 19 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/MXBeevKUsX  Ilva the Winter had always imagined her...
caption:
Til Death Do Us Part… - Wedding Day 19 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/MXBeevKUsX 

Ilva the Winter had always imagined her wedding day to be the most beautiful day of her life. And even though she loves Jon Snow more than anything else in the world, she can’t help missing the man she had planned this wedding with. But Robb Stark died on a battlefield far away from home and Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her now. Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her and Jon now. 

*A modern Game of Thrones fanfiction with a female OC describing the wedding day and Ilva’s life with Robb and with Jon*

summary: Love Transcends A Wall - Kateis_Cakeis - Game of Thrones (Video Game 2014) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Love Transcends A Wall - Kateis_Cakeis - Game of Thrones (Video Game 2014) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
When the wights crumbled, Gared knew it was almost time to head south. To Ironrath. The threat was over, the North Grove no longer required protection. He needed to know if House Forrester survived.

But seeing Jon again was not part of the plan.

Once, he had chosen his family before all else. But now? Well, four years could change a lot in people.

And it was never a secret that Gared cared deeply for Jon. Maybe he still did.

–

It may be 2019 but here I am with a GarJon fic! It’s been so long since I’ve written these two, and perhaps this fic can finally give them some peace :)

I hope you enjoy!

It may be 2019 but here I am with a GarJon fic! It’s been so long since I’ve written these two, and perhaps this fic can finally give them some peace :)

I hope you enjoy!

summary: Your opinions on book Jonsa and show Jonsa?
title: Your opinions on book Jonsa and show Jonsa?
body:
Your opinions on book Jonsa and show Jonsa?

Following from this ask: book Jonsa and show Jonsa to me have the same core dynamic, but are very different in the details. The thing is that the book and show versions of the characters are radically different: show Sansa is a more haughty and callous character than her book version, and Jon tends to be more… bumbling?

I wrote about this a little bit in my first two rereads, but book Jon has a lot more moral greyness, practicality, and competence than show Jon. Quoting from my reread:

Jon’s cold practically is an aspect of his character that doesn’t really get explored much in fanfic, or even really included at all. There’s a couple reasons for it, I think. First, even if they have read the books, the show’s presentation of Jon tends to be what sticks in most people’s heads, and the show has definite habit of softening and whitewashing Jon’s character so he can be the Hero, not to mention Kit Harington’s constantly plaintive look.
Second, I think a lot of fic writers prefer to have Sansa be the cold hard one (which is also a show invention, but we’ll get into that later) paired with Jon as the emotionally softer one. Which is fair. I love that contrast and dynamic. But I do wish we got a little more examination and exploration of the parallels between how they both got to their Stark face and how they interact now.

This post by Turtle Paced also does a really great job of going in depth about what I like about book Jon.

Both book and show Sansa I find interesting, but I almost always write the book version of her, which is a lot softer: Fifty Shades of Snow is the exception, where she’s far more based on her show version (thus her height in that fic). I tend to let show Jon slip a bit more into my fic just because it’s funny when he’s awkward.

I may do a whole post on this at some point after I’ve done more rereads. It’s been interesting going back to the source material and looking at what’s actually on the page versus the fandom idea of the characters that’s cropped up.

Thanks for the question!

caption: “And the relationship she has with Jon Snow is, I still believe, the truest, most real love she experiences in her entire life. So for that to be the way that it ends … obviously there’s a poetry to it, but there’s a huge amount of pain that comes with it. Think about what Dany went through. (…) Imagine working your way up and suddenly at the last hurdle, this … cute boy with curly hair comes along and screws everything up because she’s in love with him and doesn’t know how to handle that. She thinks she can have it all with him, that he can give her what she’s been craving her whole life. And he turns out to be not what she thought and he will choose someone over her. Again, her worth isn’t enough for anyone else.” - Emilia Clarke, LA Times

summary: Happy Birthday in advance! For the birthday ask, what attracted you to Jonsa/how did you come to ship them? Your opinions on...
question: Happy Birthday in advance! For the birthday ask, what attracted you to Jonsa/how did you come to ship them? Your opinions on book Jonsa and show Jonsa? What other ships do you ship? Also, just read your fic Tipsy in a Red Push Up Bra yesterday and I loved it! Can’t wait for the final chapter!
answer:
Funnily enough, I remember exactly how and when I got into Jonsa. I follow an excellent asoiaf meta blog (ASOIAF University) and a couple years back they reblogged this and this meta by Just A Dram about Jon and Sansa and westerosi views on cousin marriage. And though I’d never, ever considered Jon and Sansa as a ship, as soon as I heard the idea it immediately clicked for me: the way Jon and Sansa might interact, the parallels in their arcs, the way that they’ve both grown into what the other wants, the way both of them are romantics who’ve had to face the harsh world.

I did what any good fan does and went to AO3 to look through some fic. Unfortunately in that first run I didn’t find any good ones, and so my interest in Jonsa kind of flagged and went dormant for a couple years. I was also pretty busy with school and trying to write my original fiction and be an adult (ugh). Though in this period I did have the idea for Jon of the Kingsguard and dashed out a rough draft of about the first third in two days.

It wasn’t until about a year ago that I thought about the ship again. I can’t really remember why; I was going through a rough period so it may be that I just wanted to lose myself in any fic. And luckily this time I almost immediately found some good fic and it started generating fic ideas of my own. For about a month I fought the temptation to write them: I’ve always wanted to be a full time writer, and I felt like putting time into fic was ultimately going to be a distraction.

But there’s only so long you can resist your muse (that fickle bitch), and that’s when I sat down and started writing Tipsy in a Red Push Up Bra. And I’m so, so glad I did. Not only have I written more in the last year than I have in the three or four years before that, but it’s given me the chance to meet so many cool people here and read really excellent fic.

This answer got long (a writer who likes to talk about themselves? Shocking, I know), so I spun the next two questions into their own posts.

Thanks for the question!
